page.title: 05ECOLOGY IN SOUTHREPPS
page.content: From loop road at Southrepps one sees, across fields the woods and coast at Trimingham. East is Gimingham, west Thorpe. Fields have been enlarged by dismantling hedges and banks, dykes filled in, thus wild life has suffered. With potatoe crops foliage is sprayed to inhibit growth, other crops also sprayed with chemicals. Small local roads are little more than gritty lanes,and there are wild flowers on the banks. During this cool summer bees and butterflies have been less evident. Public footpaths are registered. There are new houses but older buildings, mostly of flint and brick may be over 200 years old. Most seem well maintained, and have gardens. Recently a few trees have been planted but the general impression is one of intensive agriculture.
